intro: Rubus lamyi, commonly known as the Lamy’s blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in humid, forested environments. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and agricultural settings.
